660632800.name: Get a guide
660632800.author: a TripAdvisor user
660632800.reviewBody: This is a very good way to enjoy a few hours. We found having a guide very informative. Especially in the traditional clothing area.

660366532.name: Only one more opinion
660366532.author: a TripAdvisor user
660366532.reviewBody: It is a very good place to spend time and also relax, it is a very nice attraction which I recommend a lot, the only bad thing is that the restaurants that are inside it are very expensive, so it is better for a picniq.

643296647.name: A visit to Polyforum
643296647.author: a TripAdvisor user
643296647.reviewBody: Orizaba city gas need recognized as one of the best places to visit and this place confirms it. This unique castle type building is full of places to go and have breakfast, lunch or dinner. If you want to walk around a garden and take a deep breath of morning fresh air, this place is for you.

640005122.name: A place for everyone
640005122.author: a TripAdvisor user
640005122.reviewBody: This place has a lot of things to do inside of it, there are a lot little museums, the most famous is "Cri-Cri museum", also there are a different kind of restaurants and a big garden that invites you to spend all day there. It has activities for all the family and they are free.

632835550.name: What Are You Waiting For....
632835550.author: a TripAdvisor user
632835550.reviewBody: What A Beautiful Visit... Every Room Filled With So Much History Hallways Inviting To Any Visitor... Young People That Work There, 5 Stars. \nPresidential Room, Museo Del Traje, Kri Kri Museum... I Had A Beautiful Time.... P.S. Had My Best Coffee There...

626702727.name: Visiting Orizaba and the Poliforum
626702727.author: a TripAdvisor user
626702727.reviewBody: Having local friends always pays off. I was taken (besides many other attractions) to the Poliforum in Orizaba. It is an amazing place. First of all, entry is free. You can visit all the rooms in the building. Museum Cri-Cri is especially interesting for children and/or grown ups who used to listen to all the nice songs written by Francisco Gabilondo Soelr.  Sit down and read a book at the "Sala de Don Quichote", look up all typical dresses of Mexico exposed in two different halls. You can sit in the chapel or have a coffee in one of the Cafes. Out doors you can walk around a huge park with different sculptures, the activities are endless. If you have a chance to go, take it!

598227641.name: Cricri Museum
598227641.author: a TripAdvisor user
598227641.reviewBody: It is an amazing journey to the childhood for enjoying with the family.The weather is perfect.\nThis investments are what Mexico needs.

591236183.name: Beautiful
591236183.author: a TripAdvisor user
591236183.reviewBody: I visited Poliforum Mier y Pesado because I wanted to visit Cri-Cri\'s museum, I was surprised with the different things they have there, art exhibitions, chapels, restaurants. It is very interesting. Don\'t miss it.

581310420.name: simply loved it
581310420.author: a TripAdvisor user
581310420.reviewBody: It used to be a retirement home for the elderly and the local government bought the building for approximately 40 million (USD). The place itself is amazing, the view at the front facade is spectacular. It has several museums and they\'re all very interesting, specially the one dedicated to Francisco Gabilondo Soler , AKA Cri-Cri who was an amazing artist who wrote and also sang so many songs aimed to children. Lots of choices when it comes to food to. It\'s a no miss when visiting Orizaba

574074776.name: Epazote great food!
574074776.author: a TripAdvisor user
574074776.reviewBody: After the \u201cTelef\u00e9rico\u201d or cable cart, we visited the Poliforum Mier y Pesado, a great medieval looking castle with well maintained landscapes and fountain, the food variety is good, there is about 8 restaurants from tapas to Mexican and coffee shops. The museum is nice and I has a chance to see a great foto expo of the Pico de Orizaba, I would recommend an interactive guide or audio tour readily available, if there was any I could not find it, also the staff could improve their language skills in English and French in order to be a 100% Pueblo M\u00e1gico. Overall great experience with free admission, you can not ask for anything more!

551012172.name: Excellent place
551012172.author: a TripAdvisor user
551012172.reviewBody: It\'s a wonderful place to eat and visit, it has a lot of museums and some sites to take a really good meals

549602664.name: Food Delight!
549602664.author: a TripAdvisor user
549602664.reviewBody: A great place for a meal, with multiple options to select from - typical or regional cuisine, desserts, coffee, top grill, there is a choice for everyone.  The old grounds of a retirement mansion are picturesque and beautiful.  There\u2019s a museum dedicated to Cri-Cri, and banquet halls if you host an event.

513427498.name: Beautiful Place
513427498.author: a TripAdvisor user
513427498.reviewBody: This is a nice place to visit at Orizaba. We went as part of a folkloric group from Puerto Rico during the Orizaba Folk Festival 2017. There are a big area with a nice fountaing at the front of the building. Kida can enjoy the place to run and play. There are a couple of stores and a nice restaurant. Is a beautiful place.

601122447.name: A zoo and a riverwalk combined
601122447.author: a TripAdvisor user
601122447.reviewBody: This amazing park features a beautiful river walk through a "magical pueblo" that also happens to be a zoo. Having room for kids to run free and see animals makes this a can\'t miss for families.

591299536.name: Nice and relaxing
591299536.author: a TripAdvisor user
591299536.reviewBody: I walked down the river and it is very relaxing. You get to see many great things like art, a park and animals. The river is very interesting with the bridges. I enjoyed it.

578085392.name: Good for a walk
578085392.author: a TripAdvisor user
578085392.reviewBody: This is a nice river, with animals (caged) on either side of the river, kind of like a Zoo. As far as I can tell, the animals are well cared for and safe. If you would like to take a stroll during your visit, this is the perfect place. And the Hotel del R\u00edo, is just besides the River, so you can stay here and fall asleep with the sound of the river.

562573401.name: Poor treatment of animals
562573401.author: a TripAdvisor user
562573401.reviewBody: This zoo is disgraceful. The animals are kept in very small cages and are purely there for show. This is not a proper zoo. It was depressing to see these poor animals being treated this way. \nI would only recommend you go to see how bad it is so you can also let them know that what they are doing is wrong.

562366717.name: Great morning walk
562366717.author: a TripAdvisor user
562366717.reviewBody: This is a rare treat in Mexico, an enjoyable walk alongside a river, in a city. Lovely way to get some exercise and visit the zoo.

561076410.name: Charming stroll
561076410.author: a TripAdvisor user
561076410.reviewBody: The pathways on either side of the small Rio Orizaba are a lovely place to stroll on a nice day.  Old houses leaning over the river are balanced by lush greenery, singing birds, and a multitude of butterflies.  All along a 1.5 km stretch are various enclosures housing a variety of animals, reptiles, and birds\u2014some local, some exotic.  The animals all appeared to be in good condition.   There is no admission fee. Well worth the stroll.  Allow an hour or so.

556142524.name: Best idea!!! Made a city river an attraction
556142524.author: a TripAdvisor user
556142524.reviewBody: There are art murals and even a zoo added to this beautiful river in the middle of the city.  Must see!!!!

549844561.name: Ecoparque Rio
549844561.author: a TripAdvisor user
549844561.reviewBody: I feel sorry for the animals as their enclosures are very small and I don\u2019t think it\u2019s appropriate. \nMe dieron lastima los animales porque el lugar en donde est\u00e1n no creo que es adecuado.

513425446.name: Nice Place to Visit
513425446.author: a TripAdvisor user
513425446.reviewBody: Was a nice and great place to visit. I went with a group of friends. You can walk around the Paseo de los Artistas o Paseo del Zoologico. At the paseo de los Artistas you can walk near the Orizaba River and you can see a lot of beautiful arts and paintings, and to the other site of the river you can see the paseo del zoologico, and there you can see a lot of beautiful animals. You can have a great time.

459215886.name: Nice walk
459215886.author: a TripAdvisor user
459215886.reviewBody: This walk is very nice and fun to do it with kids. Even when it is long, you can walk as much as you can and take one of the exits and take a taxi. You can see several species of animals along the walk and this amazes the kids who will love it. Dont forget to take the cable car to the "Cerro del borrego".

445932929.name: River Walk Zoo
445932929.author: a TripAdvisor user
445932929.reviewBody: Excellent walk for the Orizaba river, you can see very healthy all the animals, you can see jaguars, monkeys, coyotes, and much more animals

411591146.name: Sad to see small cages...
411591146.author: a TripAdvisor user
411591146.reviewBody: ... but a good way to stretch your legs. Feeding fresh berries to the exotic birds was fun. The ostriches were in bad shape and some animals were not there.

366493375.name: Kind of a zoo on the river side.
366493375.author: a TripAdvisor user
366493375.reviewBody: walked along the river through crossed many rope bridges, the animal cages are lined along the river . Excellent up keep , saw a lama for the first time.Nice to walk on the river and also see the animals.

351525676.name: Excellent City Amenity
351525676.author: a TripAdvisor user
351525676.reviewBody: We accessed the walk where the gondola terminates on the river.  The walk covers both sides of the small stream and it runs continuous through most of the downtown with a path on both sides.  Paralleling each side there is a linear zoo with many different animals on display.  Not the greatest environment for the inmates but a thrill for young kids and their parents.  There is also a remnant of an old viaduct, a portion of which house some of the zoo animals.  A most desirable city attribute.

286988142.name: "Strolling by the paseo del Rio and seeing animals in the way"
286988142.author: a TripAdvisor user
286988142.reviewBody: Orizaba has many charms and great places to see beauty and enjoy a pleasant walk. Strolling around the city and getting into the paseo del Rio is a pleasant experience.  As you walk you will see animals along the river.  Great place for families with little children and will not cost anything.  A lot street vendors and great food along the way.

282364877.name: Nice walk along the river with many animals
282364877.author: a TripAdvisor user
282364877.reviewBody: We visited the river after having read the different comments on Tripadvisor. First we expected some kind of zoological garden, but in fact it\'s rather a walk along the river and there you will find different cages with animals all along the river. It\'s a really nice walk, especially with children it can be a nice experience! The direction of walk does not matter much, you can either start in the south and walk up the river, or the other way round.

657860986.name: Wonderfully silly
657860986.author: a TripAdvisor user
657860986.reviewBody: Actually worth a visit.  If you are with kids, definitely worth it.  Free.  Life-sized models of your favorite dinos (with a totally incongruous chapel with a bleeding Jesus in the middle) labled in Spanish.  Pretty thin on the science end, but what is there seems accurate and current.  Nice views.  Bit of a walk from the center, or a cheap cab ride.

671231009.name: Great cafe!
671231009.author: a TripAdvisor user
671231009.reviewBody: We only spent a small amount of time at each small room exhibit, but we did eat breakfast at their cafe twice. We sat on the veranda and had great coffee and delicious food. The service was also very good.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

667634775.name: A little piece of Europe
667634775.author: a TripAdvisor user
667634775.reviewBody: It\'s a beautiful building made by iron and wood, and localizated in downtown. Inside, you can find some little museums with different kind of exhibitions, a nice cafe and the tourism office.The entrance is free.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

639289216.name: small with lots of expositions
639289216.author: a TripAdvisor user
639289216.reviewBody: they have different expositions, very interesting, staff is super nice. no entrance fee, there is a coffee shop on site

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

601121424.name: Beautiful palace in the center of town
601121424.author: a TripAdvisor user
601121424.reviewBody: This beautiful building in the center of Orizaba is worth a visit. Housing free exhibits (a beer museum, a futbol museum, and interactive science room and artifacts and reproductions of local anthropological finds) the building itself is worth seeing. The grounds are very pretty and its all free! Good for ages 5 and up.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

591235218.name: Beautiful monument
591235218.author: a TripAdvisor user
591235218.reviewBody: A nice building built by Gustave Eiffel. They have several exhibitions of Orizaba\'s history. The caf\u00e9 on the first floor is nice and good.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

581310882.name: AMAZING
581310882.author: a TripAdvisor user
581310882.reviewBody: It was designed by no other than Gustave Eiffel, yeap, the same guy who designed The Eiffel Tower in Paris. It was brought piece by piece to Orizaba from Belgium. There\'s a tourist office in site and a couple of museums, (beer and football museums) most people don\'t know it but Orizaba is considered the birth place of football in Mexico as many english men would come to Orizaba to work in the different existing factories that established there many years ago, therefore, the visit to this museum is quite interesting.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

562366324.name: Nice place for an evening drink
562366324.author: a TripAdvisor user
562366324.reviewBody: This is a lovely place to visit and also to have a drink in the cafe. Amazing history and some nice museums inside.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

522405537.name: Interesting construction
522405537.author: a TripAdvisor user
522405537.reviewBody: Made totally of riveted metal. Small gift shop, historical center. Restaurant for coffee and desserts. On the corner of the Park.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

513429310.name: GREAT BUILDING
513429310.author: a TripAdvisor user
513429310.reviewBody: The Iron Palace is a great and beautiful building at Orizaba near one of the city Catedral. They have a fountain and beautiful flowers around. There you can see Goverment offices, the Beer Museum, nice place to visit and a nice store with great coffe.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

445928620.name: The best coffe ever - But the service was horrible
445928620.author: a TripAdvisor user
445928620.reviewBody: The place, the environment and the flavors are excellent, but could be a perfect place if the service change, I believe than the waiters need some trainee, they are not use to have a 5 start service

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

441000600.name: Great
441000600.author: a TripAdvisor user
441000600.reviewBody: If you visit Orizaba you will not miss this iron palace, the entrance is for free and you can take a good coffee over there. Gustave Eiffel did a great job

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

437796488.name: Cool hangout
437796488.author: a TripAdvisor user
437796488.reviewBody: We went for a beer and some music at one of the coffeeshops. There were a lot of people just hanging out, having fun. Cool, relaxed place that\'s definitely worth seeing.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

411589657.name: Not what I was expecting...
411589657.author: a TripAdvisor user
411589657.reviewBody: Made of metal? Check. Nothing else... even the Beer Museum is tiny and free of any beer. There is a guide service there that can arrange for other things to do though.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

396391357.name: A must see in Orizaba!
396391357.author: a TripAdvisor user
396391357.reviewBody: A wonderful building in a lovely city. We love to stop for a coffee at the Gran Cafe and browse through the palace.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

357894618.name: A jewel of the Industrial Revolution in Mexico
357894618.author: a TripAdvisor user
357894618.reviewBody: This palace was designed at the end of the XIX Century by Gustav Eiffel, its a beautiful piece of Nouveau architecture. It used to be the city hall a long time ago, now you can enjoy it by entering in any of his museums, it\'s the heart of the city and an example of luxury and industrialization from the past times of the region.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

343286933.name: a beatiful palace
343286933.author: a TripAdvisor user
343286933.reviewBody: The palace is complety made from iron. It was designed by Eifel, know from the Eifel tower in Paris. First is was erected in Belgium and later transported by ship from Europe to Mexico. There is a nice cafetaria/bar inside with a good terrace. Inside ther are a few small musea : about beer and abot football. The tourist office is also there

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

333671297.name: Great staff Estabial hosted as guide and explained the rocks & roots of the Orizaba landscape!
333671297.author: a TripAdvisor user
333671297.reviewBody: Besides Palacio Del Hierro being a landmark unique building of its time, houses an excellent exhibition of Rocks & Roots providing great educational information!  My host staff guide Ms.  Estabial was very enthusiastic - mutually - entertaining with her practice of describing in English & and my genuine attempt in acknowledging my understanding of Spanish language!

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

286978746.name: Beautiful structure with long history
286978746.author: a TripAdvisor user
286978746.reviewBody: This palace of iron has been a symbol standing in time for the Orizaba people. Beautiful structure, located in the center of the city with colorful gardens, fountains and quiet places to seat and observe the movement of the city walking traffic. Close to the catedral, the public market, malls, and dining places.  Walking distance of almost everything.  just love this place!

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

282365282.name: Nice building in front of the cathedral
282365282.author: a TripAdvisor user
282365282.reviewBody: This is a very special building, because it is mainly built with steel. It is quite surprising how many details of decoration you can find! Don\'t forget to visit the Zocalo (main square) just around the corner.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

268438729.name: A nice piece of history!
268438729.author: a TripAdvisor user
268438729.reviewBody: The Palacio de Hierro (Iron Palace) was originally brought in pieces by ship from Belgium as a request from the local government in 1891. This Art Noveau metal contruction was originally designed by Gustave Eiffel and it was assembled by Mexican workers in Orizaba. It is located downtown, right across from the Cathedral, and it was the local City Hall for more than 90 years. It currently hosts 3 museums, the local Tourism Bureau, and a caf\u00e9.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

263977898.name: Eiffel in Orizaba?  Who Knew?
263977898.author: a TripAdvisor user
263977898.reviewBody: A building made entirely out of metal, designed by Gustaf Eiffel, built in Belgium and shipped to Orizaba a long time ago.  Who knew?  Lots of quirky little museums, the town\'s tourist office and a fantastic care await you here.  A great place to hang out in Orizaba.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

256728125.name: Singular edificio/ Unique building
256728125.author: a TripAdvisor user
256728125.reviewBody: Porfirio Diaz trajo este edificio, hecho en Belgica, en 3 barcos y tardaron 2 anyos en armar todas las placas de hierro. Hay un cafe, la oficina de turismo, varios museos chicos. \nAn iron palace, brought from Europe in the early 20th century in 3 boats. It took 2 years to put together all the iron plaques and they have tried to respect the original structure. It houses the tourism office, a nice cafe and several small museums.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

223076196.name: Historic Iron Palace From The Past Century Brought From France
223076196.author: a TripAdvisor user
223076196.reviewBody: This is a golden gem in the city of Orizaba, it was designed by the same architect of the Eifel Tower. It has several government offices and a great coffee place to chill and watch people walk by.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

216071287.name: Iron Palace
216071287.author: a TripAdvisor user
216071287.reviewBody: Main Attraction in Orizaba, the Iron palace was made by the same man who designed the Eiffel tower. It is on t-shirts, mugs and keychains as a main attraction in Orizaba and all for good reason. Great place to come and have a quiet coffee while gazing at this magnificent structure (even more remarkable when you find out each piece of iron, all the nuts, bolts and screws were all brought over from France. Well worth a visit, cultural gem.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

214846752.name: Eiffel designed what? In Mexico?
214846752.author: a TripAdvisor user
214846752.reviewBody: Palacio de Hierro is another hidden treasure of Mexico. Located in the city center of Orizaba is a spectacular Eiffel design that is a pleasant surprise off the usual tourist path. About 2 hours south of Puebla the city would be a good choice as an easy day trip either with tour or by bus, it\'s worth the effort. The structure is entirely of metal with wood windows and floors, shipped from Belgium by steamships and inaugurated in 1891. Now when you enter the front doors the coffee aroma draws you into a pleasant cafe with the most beautiful coffee "bar", (art deco design) and the best ice cream desserts, a true delight. There are small museums to visit, flags, presidents, beer( oh yes, this is the city of beers) soccer (this is where soccer was introduced in Mexico) and a space museum. There\'s also a new teleferico in the center that climbs 285m above the city with a view, not cloudy, of majestic Mt Orizaba.

address.streetAddress: Av. Francisco I. Madero Esquina Poniente 2

671230874.name: Fun visit, great view
671230874.author: a TripAdvisor user
671230874.reviewBody: We enjoyed the ride to the top with great views. Each car was comfortable and with big windows. There\'s not much to do at the top but fun to walk around, see the small buildings and enjoy the view.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

667735996.name: Other type of transport
667735996.author: a TripAdvisor user
667735996.reviewBody: It\'s a different way for arriving to "El cerro del borrego", besides you can get there walking, taking the cable car give you another sightseeing of the city and good experience.\nI don\u00b4t recommend it to those who are scared of heights.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

660633173.name: A must do
660633173.author: a TripAdvisor user
660633173.reviewBody: Didnt see the mountain as it was foggy, but enjoyed the nature and the views of the city. Climb the viewing platform its fun.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

632833701.name: A Must Do
632833701.author: a TripAdvisor user
632833701.reviewBody: From Start To Finish Was A Very Beautiful Experience, Took The Cable Car Up Was Only 50 Pesos Beautiful Views Of City... Lots Of Little Museums To Visit. Lot History... Talk To The Locals... I Took The Hike Path Down... My First Trip. Medium Hiking.\nCars Leave Every 6 Minutes But You Can Hop On Any Time You Are Ready To Go Down.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

626704711.name: Going to the top
626704711.author: a TripAdvisor user
626704711.reviewBody: Being in Orizaba, you should take a ride with the cable car to the mountain \'Cerro del Borrego\'. The view going up is really nice and on top you have the chance of walking around plane nature. You will find 2 sorts of museums (very simple ones mind you) explaining the history around Orizaba. It also houses a cabin where you can eat your meal, which you are allowed to bring with you. Some views are absolutely gorgeous. You can even adventure zipping down at the Tirolesa station. The gardens are beautiful to walk through and you will probably see many different kind of butterflies. \nFor the really hard liners: You can actually walk up/down the mountain instead of taking the teleferico!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

609343104.name: Impressive views, weather, history
609343104.author: a TripAdvisor user
609343104.reviewBody: The teleferico\'s access is located at the downtown across the street from the City Hall and next to a free mini zoo in a nice updated touristic area.   The ascend/descend trip offers a great view of the city and the surrounding areas.   The weather change from the city to the top of the "Cerro del Borrego" is big, prepare for a cooler stay at the top.   In the top of the hill you can find several activities and two of them are recommended:  A guided tour to an historic building and a short representation of the main battle that was held there in 1862.\nWe got some rain up there in our visit and it gets chilly if you are not prepared for it.\nIt is a very relaxing adventure, recommended for everybody and do not need to perform any athletic effort.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

601120161.name: "High" light of the trip
601120161.author: a TripAdvisor user
601120161.reviewBody: Taking the Teleferico in Orizaba is an amazing experience. The trip up the mountain takes 6 minutes and provides a panoramic view of the area. There is a small history museum (free) and a zip line ($100MX). The views are stunning. \nBe warned-the lines can be long, so go early and make this the 1st thing you do. Solo travellers can sometimes be "advanced" in the line as each car holds 6 people. Well worth the fee. Good for all ages. Fear of heights would be a problem. Having some Spanish is very helpful.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

595258344.name: Beautiful Place to visit
595258344.author: a TripAdvisor user
595258344.reviewBody: Went with my husband\'s family along with our 5 year old son, and we enjoyed it.  The view as we went up, was spectacular. Once at the top, there is a park/historic place which in itself is beautiful. There is a small shop, small playgroud area, ziplining, museum etc.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

578084968.name: Nice, great views and wonderful hill
578084968.author: a TripAdvisor user
578084968.reviewBody: I went with my husband and 3 year oild, and we all enjoyed it. The views are great, the hill of "El Borrego" which has a small museum, kids playground, and a wonderful view. If you want to hike it, you can do so as well. I highly recommend this activity for the whole family.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

577469278.name: S\u00faper recomendado.
577469278.author: a TripAdvisor user
577469278.reviewBody: No pierdan la experiencia de subir al telef\u00e9rico y pasar un rato agradable en el cerro del borrego. La entrada es s\u00faper accesible, fui en viernes y el costo fue de $30 MXN. \n\nI recommend this places, it is a nice place to spend time with you friends, family, etc. The price of \u201cTelef\u00e9rico(cableway)\u201d It is very accessible, I went on a Friday and only paid the amount of $30 MXN. Normally the price is between $30 and $50 MXN.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

574073710.name: Great View !
574073710.author: a TripAdvisor user
574073710.reviewBody: The cable cart is in excellent condition, aprox. 2 USD the round trip of about 1 km.  The employees are helpful and gave us enough information about safety and the eco park on top of the hill, great experience overall, however the experience on top of the hill could be improved, with better food and a small souvenir shop.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

562574183.name: Good views
562574183.author: a TripAdvisor user
562574183.reviewBody: We took the chair lift up and then walked down. Was a fun ride up with great views. The lift is in great condition and is comfortable. \nThe park at the top is pretty average and very man made. We thought it would have had better view of Pico de Orizaba but you can only really see the peak. The views of the valley are fantastic though. \nWould definitely recommend doing it if you are in Orizaba.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

562365909.name: Excellent views across the city
562365909.author: a TripAdvisor user
562365909.reviewBody: Really enjoyed my trip on the telef\u00e9rico. Not expensive at all and the views are amazing. Nice and cool up there too!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

561075666.name: Do it!
561075666.author: a TripAdvisor user
561075666.reviewBody: The normal price is 50pesos r/t, but I got there for some sort of sale, and paid only 30. This also includes entrance fees for a few other attractions, including the excellent museum of art.  The top of the hill affords great views, and is covered with native cloud forest.  There is a small museum and a cafe.  If you wish, there is a good trail to take you through the trees, bromeliads, flowers, and butterflies back into town.  Well worth it!  (Caveat: it was a clear day!)

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

557243815.name: worthwhile
557243815.author: a TripAdvisor user
557243815.reviewBody: Excellent views, plus a little bit of Orizaba\'s  history. Nice walking trails. Worth the 35 pesos, or whatever it was.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

556142142.name: Must DO!!! Great views of all of Orizaba
556142142.author: a TripAdvisor user
556142142.reviewBody: Came in the winter and was bummed out the zip lines are only operated during the hot days.  Great experience and knowledgeable there is a museum and even eating areas at the top.  Definitely recommended.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

553737208.name: Worth every peso spend
553737208.author: a TripAdvisor user
553737208.reviewBody: Locals said its to expensive for them. That\u2019s why they can\u2019t tell you how much fun wow experience it\u2019s to ride in it. To us was the best ride!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

549601913.name: The Views
549601913.author: a TripAdvisor user
549601913.reviewBody: Awesome experience for the kids (young and old)!  Family friendly area to walk, view the city, learn more about history, and enjoy a fun time.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

540789870.name: A must see, well worth the money.
540789870.author: a TripAdvisor user
540789870.reviewBody: This trip to the top of a mountain for a panoramic Vista of the City of Orizaba cannot be missed. The fee is nominal, the staff polite, and the park at the top of the mountain is very well kept, with bathrooms, a tiny store, a small restaurant, and a small museum. Highly recommendable.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

537676125.name: Fantastic!
537676125.author: a TripAdvisor user
537676125.reviewBody: This was a great 1-1/2 hour activity. I expected just the ride up and down to observe the area, so I was pleasantly surprised to find a park on top of the mountain. I am afraid of zip lines, but I enjoyed a walk, little museum, and an observation deck with a magnificent 350 view.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

513425287.name: GREAT EXPERIENCE
513425287.author: a TripAdvisor user
513425287.reviewBody: Visit the "TELESFERICO DE ORIZABA", was a great experience. We visited the atraction with a group of friends that participated as a group during the Orizaba Folk Festival 2017. You must see a beautiful view of the city going up and down. At the top there are a great park to walk around at the top, you can also see the top of the "Volcano Pico de Orizaba" and also there are a Zip Line. The cost is not expensive. I recommended this trip at Orizaba.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

491098564.name: Beautiful
491098564.author: a TripAdvisor user
491098564.reviewBody: Beautiful view going up and down. Also has a lovely park to walk around at the top. Definatly must go if in orizaba.  Also very inexpensive obly 30 pesos per person when we visited.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

445929189.name: Great Views
445929189.author: a TripAdvisor user
445929189.reviewBody: This is a excellent experience, the views, the safe and of course the environment are great, and also is very cheap, around 3 box round trip

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

442144753.name: Cable car
442144753.author: a TripAdvisor user
442144753.reviewBody: Thoroughly enjoyed visiting the town of Orizaba and spent the morning travelling on the cable car. Lovely natural park at the top. Definitely worth a visit

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

441000322.name: Perfect!
441000322.author: a TripAdvisor user
441000322.reviewBody: If you visit Orizaba, you have to go there deffinitely. Nice view on the hill, the price 50 mx for bouth ways is great. Recommending

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

411589104.name: Enjoy the view!
411589104.author: a TripAdvisor user
411589104.reviewBody: Absolutely stunning views of the surrounding valley. Walked aroud the top and had to climb the last bit... definately is better to ride!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

409495217.name: Good experience
409495217.author: a TripAdvisor user
409495217.reviewBody: Nice ride to watch the whole valley at once. On special occasions there are representations of the battle held during the french occupation which was few days previous to the famous 5 de mayo battle. In my opinion it could improve if at the top, they had guides explaining what you watch from there with some historical facts.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

409151033.name: August 2016 visit
409151033.author: a TripAdvisor user
409151033.reviewBody: We visited here on August the 18th. We had a lovely time, my two children loved it, it was exciting, staff very friendly, we queued up for 30 mins, not too bad. Once we were up in the mountain we enjoyed the amazing scenery. Interesting little museum and chapel. Will highly recommend. Will call again next time.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

396392244.name: Kids loved it!
396392244.author: a TripAdvisor user
396392244.reviewBody: A fun ride and some nice views on top. There\'s a nice trail up if you want a hike, but the kids really enjoyed the ride. The Rio Ecoparque/zoo is at the base of the teleferico, so there\'s plenty to see. Visit Orizaba!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

389205482.name: Good but short
389205482.author: a TripAdvisor user
389205482.reviewBody: Short trip and long time to wait. A museum waiting at the top compensates the waiting time. You have some snack places at the bottom and you have a nice view of the Orizaba valley.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

378830166.name: Fun and nature
378830166.author: a TripAdvisor user
378830166.reviewBody: Very nice ride to the top of El Borrego mountain with great views of the city and the french canyons\nA great view of thePico de Orizaba

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

378769669.name: Fantastic Breathtaking View
378769669.author: a TripAdvisor user
378769669.reviewBody: A small wait to take you to the top of an amazing view. Once you get to the top here is a small cantina and there are a couple of paths to follow. You can circle the top (almost fully) to see other villas surrounding Orizaba. \n

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

357892941.name: In the Top of the city
357892941.author: a TripAdvisor user
357892941.reviewBody: Good to get a full view of the city. Try to be early and get soon in the cablecar it will get you to the top of the Cerro del Borrego and you can enjoy a great view of the whole city, in the top you can also see the other side of the mountain and meet Rio Blanco. Be aware that the cablecar is a machine and sometimes they broke up and you may get stuck in the top but that rarely happens.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

347428804.name: Fun for trail walkers
347428804.author: a TripAdvisor user
347428804.reviewBody: Excelet service, a great way to spend time with nature and friends.\n\nCome here with tennis shoes and energy.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

343287931.name: nice view on the montains
343287931.author: a TripAdvisor user
343287931.reviewBody: It is a modern teleferique that goes up to a hill from where you have a beautiful view on the snow capped Orozaba mountain. Up ther is also a park with severel vieuwpoints and a zone for walking

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

333614403.name: Leisure
333614403.author: a TripAdvisor user
333614403.reviewBody: Great experience not only for tourists but Orizabananeos family fun trip!  Seeing children and adults thrill reaction is quite a lasting memory!

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

330706485.name: Spectacular and breathtaking
330706485.author: a TripAdvisor user
330706485.reviewBody: If you ever go to Orizaba, this is the place to visit.   Is amazing, the views are spectacular and breathtaking.   The ride can be a bit intimidating if you don\'t like heights but it is completely worth it.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

305170892.name: Worth the vertigo
305170892.author: a TripAdvisor user
305170892.reviewBody: I am afraid of heights and I suffered the whole way up but the view from the top and the smiles on my boys\' faces made the trip worth it. Bring hiking boots or tennis shoes to walk the trails on the top because with the mud it can be slippery. You get a maximum of 2 hours to explore the mountain before having to come back down.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

287772163.name: "Beautiful view from the top of the Hill"
287772163.author: a TripAdvisor user
287772163.reviewBody: The Orizaba  telef\u00e9rico will take you from the center of the city until the top of the Borrego Hill where you can admire the city at 360 degre angulo. Pretty incredible view and great place to admire the beauty.  A the top you can visit a little museum, little store, a park for children, scenic views, great place for pictures and plenty of place walking through the paths in the forest.  If you are a nature lover this will a great place to visit. Great for families with little children. Tickets are $50,00 pesos and I will recommend going  early in the day.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

263981111.name: Fun Ride and a Great View
263981111.author: a TripAdvisor user
263981111.reviewBody: The Orizaba Teleferico goes up to a hill overlooking town.  From here you get a 360 view of the town and surrounding countryside.  It\'s a fun ride up and down and you can walk  around the top of the hill.  There\'s a lovely forest on top, a small comedor and museum.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

257083065.name: Linda vista, muy seguro. Safe & a great view
257083065.author: a TripAdvisor user
257083065.reviewBody: Soy un poco miedosa de las alturas pero se sinti\u00f3 bastante seguro y no es muy largo el viaje. Es hermosa la vista y all\u00e1 arriba hay varias cosas interesantes tambi\u00e9n.\nI\'m a bit afraid of heights but managed fine. This is new, high quality and the trip isn\'t too long. Great view from above and several interesting things to do on the hilltop.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

248848800.name: Awesome addition to this lovely town
248848800.author: a TripAdvisor user
248848800.reviewBody: Cable car that takes you up to Cerro del Borago. Tickets sell out fast, so you\'d want to get tickets in advance. Wait time to go up was pretty quick, wait time to come back down was a little longer. Make sure you wear athletic shoes and take a jacket if you plan on being there after dark.

address.streetAddress: Poniente 3 y 5 Centro Histórico atrás del palacio municipal

543439997.name: Very romantic
543439997.author: a TripAdvisor user
543439997.reviewBody:
This is a very beatiful and romantic park to visit in the evening. As a matter of fact, be prepared to see local teens smooching softly here and there :)

The beautiful pictures of the park in the evening are true. It is tastefully lit with different colors, the grounds are meticulously maintained. There are several uber nice restaurants in the building inside, as well as gift shop, and s very modern digital library/learning center (I believe there is a small fee to use it;  typically used for classes or personal internet use). And I would not call it simply an internet cafe. It is truly a “center.”

The park is located in sparkly downtown, which is a pleasure to walk around to and from the park. Enjoy!

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

540790577.name: Great place to just walk around or take it easy.
540790577.author: a TripAdvisor user
540790577.reviewBody: This lovely park at the foot of a mountain has been around for centuries. My boys\' great grandmother used to roller skate here. Filled with tradition, it has also received a great face lift in the last couple of years. There are areas for pets, for children, a huge exercise area, and a great variety of snacks provided by vendors. A great way to spend a couple of hours with the locals.

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

445937542.name: Huge playground for children
445937542.author: a TripAdvisor user
445937542.reviewBody: I love the place, you can rent bicycles, eat chicharrones, walk around, make exercise, play football, there are swims, slides, a lot of things for children, excellent place to be with the entire family

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

385014827.name: June 2016 Alameda Orizaba Veracruz
385014827.author: a TripAdvisor user
385014827.reviewBody: I went back after 2 years and they have done some really nice additions to the Alameda nice little cottages for the vendors, they added a waterfall, very clean nice to go relax and walk around lots of places to sit

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

288143199.name: Children paradise
288143199.author: a TripAdvisor user
288143199.reviewBody: Orizaba is a very nice town and I was pleasantly surprised to see lots of green areas and parks. Many places to seat  in this family-children park.  In the middle of the park you will see the monument of Don Francisco Gabilondo Soler a native Orizabeno who his children songs and music were famous in all Mexico. The monument is of simple beauty but to really appreciate it you have to take time to learn and hear some songs and music from "Cri cri" el gallito cantor.

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

268512518.name: Who\'s that one over there? It\'s CriCri!
268512518.author: a TripAdvisor user
268512518.reviewBody: One of the dearest and most prolific Orizaban composers for children, this statue is set to remaind all of us the marvelous times we can spend listening to his music, either children or adults! He was originally born in the city, but he was not able to get fame and success until he moved to Mexico City.There, he devoted himself to continue writing songs and stories for children, which allowed him to stay forever in our hearts. Located at the Alameda park, children and adults meet CriCri (his nickname) everyday and remainds us of how beautiful life can be.

itemReviewed.name: Alameda Francisco Gabilondo Soler Cri Cri

554191531.name: A most for kids
554191531.author: a TripAdvisor user
554191531.reviewBody:
Gabilondo Soler was the composer of the most popular songs for kids ever in Mexico. Funny, creative, rhythmical lyrics that have stayed in our minds and our lives.

At this place you can listen to the song and enjoy the wonderfully made clay recreations the depict the core of the lyrics. For those of us who know the songs, it is impossible to pass by every setting without singing. 

If you do not know the songs, you will have fun watching people sing the soundtrack of their childhood. 

Such a wonderful experience.

668981606.name: Vale la pena
668981606.author: a TripAdvisor user
668981606.reviewBody: Es un bono paseo para pasar el d\u00eda vale la pena y el telef\u00e9rico cuesta 50 pesos por persona tiene muy bonitos paisajes de Orizaba recomendable ampliamente si quieres respirar aire puro u te gusta la naturaleza

668637784.name: Muy bonito lugar para visitar
668637784.author: a TripAdvisor user
668637784.reviewBody: Muy bonito lugar para visitar, agradable clima, se puede ver la ciudad desde las alturas, hay diversas actividades en el cerro.\nLa tirolesa es la mejor atracci\u00f3n, muy segura y divertida. Hay un peque\u00f1o museo relacionado con la batalla en contra de los franceses, tambi\u00e9n se encuentran las ruinas de un peque\u00f1o fuerte en donde soldados mexicanos fueron atacados mientras dorm\u00edan por las tropas francesas. SI te gusta de practicar atletismo de monta\u00f1a, el lugar es ideal. Sitio altamente recomendable para visitar. Se llega por medio del telef\u00e9rico.

668442964.name: excelente
668442964.author: a TripAdvisor user
668442964.reviewBody: excelente de prncipio a fin mucha limpieza excelente clima..accesible bonito lugar mucha tranquilidad

666792993.name: Camino a veracruz
666792993.author: a TripAdvisor user
666792993.reviewBody: Muy relajante el pueblo de Orizaba. Vali\u00f3 la pena la parada entre Puebla y Veracruz. Subimos al parque del cerro del borrego y la vista es maravillosa

659502732.name: QUIERES ALGO DIFERENTE?
659502732.author: a TripAdvisor user
659502732.reviewBody: Este Eco parque es totalmente un bello paseo para los que visitamos por primera vez, te recomiendo llevar zapato c\u00f3modo. la vista desde la parte alta te va a encantar.

653024286.name: Historia, naturaleza y belleza
653024286.author: a TripAdvisor user
653024286.reviewBody: Se puede subir al cerro caminando o por medio del telef\u00e9rico, en la cima hay un museo en el que se relata la importancia del cerro en la historia de Orizaba, \u00e1reas para convivir, tirolesa, \u00e1reas de descanso y lo m\u00e1s importante una hermosa vista de la ciudad.

650720589.name: Vistas maravillosas
650720589.author: a TripAdvisor user
650720589.reviewBody: Llegu\u00e9 a la cima del cerro v\u00eda telef\u00e9rico, es buena opci\u00f3n para evitar fatigas. Estando arriba la vista de la ciudad es muy bonita, si llegas temprano y el clima se presta puedes admirar el Citlalt\u00e9petl desde el mirador m\u00e1s alto del cerro. Por las noches las luces de la ciudad te regalan una hermosa vista. Ideal para ir en familia o disfrutar en pareja.

648636831.name: Visita al telef\u00e9rico de Orizaba
648636831.author: a TripAdvisor user
648636831.reviewBody: Una incre\u00edble experiencia, desde la llegada a la ciudad de Orizaba, se logra un ambiente pacifico y al llegar al telef\u00e9rico sorprende lo econ\u00f3mico del paseo y la belleza del cerro del borrego y sus veredas, sumamente recomendable para un d\u00eda agradable con la familia.

647486259.name: Una hermosa vista de la ciudad
647486259.author: a TripAdvisor user
647486259.reviewBody:
El ecoparque cerro del borrego cuenta con una de las mejores vistas de la ciudad.

Tanto si te gustan los paseos al aire libre como si eres fanático de las alturas, este parque te agradará.

Cuenta con varios senderos donde puedes apreciar la fauna local, además de diversos miradores como son el nido del águila y la torre de vigilancia.

645443118.name: Agradables vistas del Pico de Orizaba y de todos los municipios de la regi\u00f3n.
645443118.author: a TripAdvisor user
645443118.reviewBody: Existe una torre met\u00e1lica de m\u00e1s de 20 m. de alto que permite una excelentes vistas del Pico de Orizaba y desde cualquier parte del cerro se aprecian todas las ciudades de alrededor: R\u00edo Blanco, Orizaba, Nogales, Ixtaczotitlan y Ciudad Mendoza, hay una tirolesa de dos l\u00edneas con un costo de 100 pesos, un peque\u00f1o museo de la invasi\u00f3n francesa en ese sitio, tienda con venta de ricas memelas, pambazos, tortas y m\u00e1s con excelente sabor, bancas para un d\u00eda de campo, comedor, una asta bandera y ca\u00f1ones, miradores, se puede llegar a pie o en el famos\u00edsimo Telef\u00e9rico de Orizaba.

642404303.name: Visita ma\u00f1anera
642404303.author: a TripAdvisor user
642404303.reviewBody: Para subir al cerro se puede hacer por un sendero caminando o por el telef\u00e9rico, el telef\u00e9rico tiene salidas cada hora de 9 a 6, cada boleto cuesta $50 pesos. Hay que llegar temprano a comprar los boletos por qu\u00e9 se llena mucho. Al llegar arriba del cerro, el parque est\u00e1 muy limpio, cuidado, tiene se\u00f1alizaciones y mapas para que puedas recorrerlo, hay una torre a la que puedes subir para apreciar la vista de la ciudad de Orizaba, tambi\u00e9n tienen una tirolesa, el costo de la tirolesa es de 100 pesos, hay una peque\u00f1a tienda donde se puede comprar caf\u00e9, pap\u00e1s, tortas, pambazos, etc. Hay mesas para sentarse a comer, puedes llevar a tu mascota, solo comprometerte a limpiar sus heces. Me gust\u00f3 mucho el parque, la vista es maravillosa.

638555247.name: Vale la pena arrivarci
638555247.author: a TripAdvisor user
638555247.reviewBody:
Attraverso il teleferico si arriva in questo parco da cui si gode di una magnifica vista.
Esiste un piccolo museo sulla lotta messicana contro i colonizzatori. per il resto natura , immersi nella natura .
Possibilità di provare un brivido facendo un giro sulla "Tirolesa": fune  tesa da punto a punto , da cui ci si lancia con imbragatura. 
Consigliato a tutti.

631709545.name: aventura
631709545.author: a TripAdvisor user
631709545.reviewBody: El paseo del cerro del borrego es incre\u00edble, desde el mirador se puede tener una vista panor\u00e1mica de orizaba y parte de r\u00edo blanco, adem\u00e1s de conocer algo de historia con el museo, que muestra una rese\u00f1a de la invasi\u00f3n de los espa\u00f1oles. y si tienes esp\u00edritu aventurero subirse a la tirolesa.

631313452.name: Muy padre
631313452.author: a TripAdvisor user
631313452.reviewBody: Se tiene una vista incre\u00edble de pr\u00e1cticamente 360 grados al caminar por los senderos que lo rodean; aparte de los museos que narran un poco de la historia de Orizaba

631100070.name: Toller Ausflug aber sehr anstrengend
631100070.author: a TripAdvisor user
631100070.reviewBody: Der Berg bietet eine tolle Aussicht. Der Weg zu Fu\u00df ist jedoch sehr anstrengend und nichts f\u00fcr unsportliche, hier bietet sich die Seilbahn an.

618692714.name: Me encanto
618692714.author: a TripAdvisor user
618692714.reviewBody: Si lo recomiendo  un lugar ecologico especial para familias largas caminatas bellos paisajes. Zona segura.

607200706.name: EcoParque
607200706.author: a TripAdvisor user
607200706.reviewBody: Excelente lugar para pasar un dia en armon\u00eda con la familia, muy buena limpieza, organizaci\u00f3n y atencion

603904147.name: diversi\u00f3n en las alturas
603904147.author: a TripAdvisor user
603904147.reviewBody: un peque\u00f1o recorrido pero muy agradable no te puedes perder todas las peque\u00f1as exposiciones y sobre todo la tiro lesa diversi\u00f3n para chicos y grandes

603330751.name: impresionante
603330751.author: a TripAdvisor user
603330751.reviewBody: una gran vista, arboles, una clima muy agradable, limpio, ba\u00f1os, esta padr\u00edsimo, recomendable, es una gran experiencia

601251869.name: Excelente!
601251869.author: a TripAdvisor user
601251869.reviewBody: Si tienen condicion fisica, suban por los escalones, personalmente solo he llegado al primer mirador, pero hasta ahi la vista es genial, subir? Con ayuda del teleferico, arriba hay de todp y la vista? La mejor de la regi\u00f3n.

601136688.name: Espectacular!
601136688.author: a TripAdvisor user
601136688.reviewBody: Experiencia familiar el lugar muy limpio y con paisajes hermosos, lleva un su\u00e9ter ligero porque al estar muy alto, es un tanto frio el ambiente.

577234343.name: Telef\u00e9rico y paseo en el cerro del borrego
577234343.author: a TripAdvisor user
577234343.reviewBody: Est\u00e1 padrisimo el telef\u00e9rico!!! No puedes perderte esta atracci\u00f3n!!!! Y hay una obra bonita de unos j\u00f3venes

573852121.name: Gran lugar para ejercitarse y tener contacto con la naturaleza.
573852121.author: a TripAdvisor user
573852121.reviewBody: Nada se compara con la hermosa vista que tiene de ambos lados; se puede llegar a la cima ya sea a pie, o por medio del telef\u00e9rico, tomando en cuenta que arriba se tiene una peque\u00f1a capilla, tienda de v\u00edveres junto con un comedor, un peque\u00f1o museo, por decirlo as\u00ed, ba\u00f1os p\u00fablicos y tirolesa, entre otras actividades recreativas.

569979237.name: El contacto ideal con la naturaleza
569979237.author: a TripAdvisor user
569979237.reviewBody: Nada como la vista que se tiene de ambos lados del cerro, subir por el telef\u00e9rico o  a pie son excelentes opciones. Contacto puro con la naturaleza, adem\u00e1s de un poco de historia.

564876872.name: Hermoso
564876872.author: a TripAdvisor user
564876872.reviewBody: Este cerro esta genial pues tiene una vista muy hermosa adem\u00e1s es un parque donde se puede encontrar una tienda,una iglesia,un comedor dentro  de una caba\u00f1a,  ba\u00f1os p\u00fablicos, una tirolesa, y varios lugares m\u00e1s para el entretenimiento al aire libre

555994033.name: 4to imperdible  de Orizba, para realizar Senderismo.
555994033.author: a TripAdvisor user
555994033.reviewBody: Se encuentra al final del recorrido del Telef\u00e9rico, cuenta con miradores en donde su pueden observar la ciudad de Orizaba y Rio Blanco, cuenta con dos peque\u00f1os museos, uno de historia y otro de cartografia. El cerro del Borrego tiene un pasado historico, se puede realizar senderismo. Recomendable llevar ropa abrigadora y calzado comodo para realizar senderismo

553283840.name: Fresco
553283840.author: a TripAdvisor user
553283840.reviewBody: Un poco de atenci\u00f3n al museo, necesario un poco m\u00e1s de historia. Un lugar muy fresco y agradable. Recomiendo ampliamente

552255179.name: EcoParque Cerro del Borrego
552255179.author: a TripAdvisor user
552255179.reviewBody: Excelentes Museos instalados en el Cerro, muy bien cuidados y es un buen hallazo al encontrarlos al bajar del Telef\u00e9rico.

550309268.name: Muy buen lugar
550309268.author: a TripAdvisor user
550309268.reviewBody: Recomendable las mejores vistas de orizaba, muy limpio excelente oportunidad de convivir con la naturaleza.

549041120.name: Espectacular vista y naturaleza
549041120.author: a TripAdvisor user
549041120.reviewBody: Puedes llegar desde el telef\u00e9rico  que te cobra 50 pesos el viaje redondo y puedes permanecer dos horas, tiempo suficiente para admirar la hermosa vista y recorrer todo el ecoparque y los museos.Llevar zapatos c\u00f3modos o tenis, pues hay partes con pendiente pronunciada y lodo. Hay tirolesa, gimnasio al aire libre, y una ruta para subir y bajar a pie, donde igual se pidr\u00eda practicar senderismo, pero los se\u00f1alamientos indican que es bajo nuestra propia responsabilidad

545150045.name: Escenarios hermosos
545150045.author: a TripAdvisor user
545150045.reviewBody: Hermosas vistas panoramicas del pueblo... durante la ma\u00f1ana es la mejor hora para visitarlo... comienza a subir antes del amanecer para poder estar ahi arriba y ver cuan maravillosa es la naturaleza.

540444565.name: El mejor mirador de Orizaba
540444565.author: a TripAdvisor user
540444565.reviewBody: Puedes ascender por el telef\u00e9rico  (6 min) o por el sendero (50 min) y lo m\u00e1s destacable es el mirador donde podr\u00e1s ver todo Orizaba. \nExisten 2 peque\u00f1os museos, uno de inter\u00e9s hist\u00f3rico que hace rese\u00f1a a la pelea contra los franceses que tuvo lugar en ese cerro (tambi\u00e9n hay ruinas de un fuerte); el segundo es el MUSGO Museo de Geograf\u00eda de Orizaba.\nSigue el sendero y llegar\u00e1s otro mirador hacia la zona de R\u00edo Blanco.

539166878.name: Muy bello lugar
539166878.author: a TripAdvisor user
539166878.reviewBody: Excelente lugar para ver la vista panor\u00e1mica de la ciudad de Orizaba y ver los cerros alrededor .. muy bello atractivo

537981235.name: Subimos por el paso peatonal
537981235.author: a TripAdvisor user
537981235.reviewBody: La entrada del cerro para subir a pie esta un poco escondida, son aproximadamente 40 min hasta la cima a un paso moderado y sin descansar. Subimos con nuestras mascotas y al regreso del viaje estabamos todos muy cansados.

537716082.name: Visita peatonal
537716082.author: a TripAdvisor user
537716082.reviewBody: La entrada peatonal est\u00e1 muy escondida, les recomiendo ir con tiempo son 40 min de escalones y camin\u00f3 sinuoso, si van con mascotas es la \u00fanica forma de subir pues el telef\u00e9rico no permite acceso con mascotas. A pesar k el peatonal est\u00e1 muy solo y da un poco de nervios.

535218543.name: De paseo por Orizaba
535218543.author: a TripAdvisor user
535218543.reviewBody: Complemento del paseo en el telef\u00e9rico, extraordinario lugar una vista espectacular, rodeado de historia nacional, tirolesa. El costo muy accesible del telef\u00e9rico y el parque en el cerro del becerro es de 50  pesos por persona.

529274857.name: Muy buena opci\u00f3n
529274857.author: a TripAdvisor user
529274857.reviewBody: Tiene un costo muy accesible y es muy bonita la vista. Sugiero ir temprano o en la tarde para evitar el calor.

516429281.name: Fabuloso!
516429281.author: a TripAdvisor user
516429281.reviewBody: Este Eco Parque esta ubicado en la cima del cerro del Borrego, al lugar puedes llegar caminando o por el telef\u00e9rico de la ciudad, cuenta con 2 museos , una tirolesa, dos miradores y mucha naturaleza, si tomas el telef\u00e9rico te permiten estar dos horas arriba y bajar por el mismo lugar, realmente vale la pena visitarlo

541992279.name: Sunday Mass
541992279.author: a TripAdvisor user
541992279.reviewBody:
I attended Sunday mass at San Miguel Cathedral, which was a typical Catholic mass anywhere in the world.

Cathedral is beautiful and service is efficient, as in addition to traditional service at the front, there are flat screen tvs along the perimeter to ensure that everyone has a good view.

The plaza upfront boasts farmers’s market with vegetables and quick eats for sale.

address.streetAddress: Francisco I. Madero Norte 88 Col. Centro

659502260.name: DIVERTIDO
659502260.author: a TripAdvisor user
659502260.reviewBody: Este peque\u00f1o mundo para ni\u00f1os que apenas comienzan a caminar es excepcionalmente llamativo, ya que se emocionan con los colores, todo quieren agarrar y subirse a experimentar... realmente muy entretenido para ellos y sobre todo para nosotros como pap\u00e1s.

658059957.name: Divertido
658059957.author: a TripAdvisor user
658059957.reviewBody: Me encanto que Orizaba no se olvidara de un lugar especial para los ni\u00f1os. Divertido, completo, creativo. No hay mucha sombra pero yendo a una hora q no haya mucho calor es s\u00faper divertido para los peques.

642092036.name: Excelente lugar para los peques
642092036.author: a TripAdvisor user
642092036.reviewBody: Es un lugar excelente para los ni\u00f1os, lo disfrutan much\u00edsimo y a parte de divertirse podemos ense\u00f1arles sobre c\u00f3mo se debe respetar las vialidades, que es un tema principal para la ciudadan\u00eda de Orizaba a la cual mis respetos. Deber\u00edan de existir m\u00e1s ciudades as\u00ed.

635698678.name: Parque para ni\u00f1os
635698678.author: a TripAdvisor user
635698678.reviewBody: lugar para que disfruten los mas peque\u00f1os de la familia, lugar limpio, seguro y sobre al aire libre, para relajarse en familia

633211967.name: increible
633211967.author: a TripAdvisor user
633211967.reviewBody: Para que los peques se diviertan y aprendan lo que es seguridad vial, esta fecto, ya que simulan una peque\u00f1a ciudad con sus calles y avenidas, las chicas les ense\u00f1an lo que es los derechos de circulaci\u00f3n y pueden jugar en las peque\u00f1as casitas que conforman el parque.

619234928.name: Excelente opci\u00f3n para los ni\u00f1os en Orizaba
619234928.author: a TripAdvisor user
619234928.reviewBody: Un parque excelente en Orizaba Veracruz totalmente gratuito instalaciones segura es muy grande los ni\u00f1os pueden pasar mucho tiempo entretenido en juegos resbaladillas columpios carros de bomberos aviones de polic\u00edas y otras cosas m\u00e1s tambi\u00e9n hay una zona donde comer y cerca de ah\u00ed caminando puedes pasar directamente al parque de los dinosaurios que tambi\u00e9n Est\u00e1 fant\u00e1stico. Altamente recomendable para familias con ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os las instalaciones son seguras

619026990.name: Su nombre lo dice todo
619026990.author: a TripAdvisor user
619026990.reviewBody: Excelente idea para que los ni\u00f1os se diviertan sin tecnolog\u00eda, a la antiguita, subiendo y bajando, de aqu\u00ed para all\u00e1, siempre con la sonrisa en la cara

604478442.name: Imperdible
604478442.author: a TripAdvisor user
604478442.reviewBody: Si visitas Orizaba y tienes ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os, no puedes dejar de visitar el parque de las sonrisas, donde se re\u00fanen una variedad de juegos infantiles y en donde los ni\u00f1os pasan un rato agradable

603332289.name: excelente para ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os
603332289.author: a TripAdvisor user
603332289.reviewBody: Este parque es una obra de arte, mas por el hecho de que la mayor\u00eda de lo autos, aviones, camiones y casitas est\u00e1n hechas de materiales reciclados en su mayor\u00eda, muy recomendable para ni\u00f1os hasta de 8 a\u00f1os, no dejaran de subir y bajar de estas construcciones, felicidades a los creadores, gran escenario para muchas fotos familiares y lo mejor, este parque y el de los dinosaurios son completamente gratis.

587862700.name: Parque de las sonrisas
587862700.author: a TripAdvisor user
587862700.reviewBody: Los juegos bien, aunque no hay sombra y cuando hace mucho calor es imposible que los ni\u00f1os est\u00e9n m\u00e1s de 10 minutos.

573842820.name: Divertido e interesante para convivir en familia.
573842820.author: a TripAdvisor user
573842820.reviewBody: Un lugar muy bonito para ir en familia pero especialmente para los ni\u00f1os ya que cuenta con diversos juegos los cuelas est\u00e1n hechos de materiales reciclados lo cual est\u00e1 muy padre por que ayuda a nuestro ambiente y crea conciencia en los ni\u00f1os y en los adultos.

552256056.name: Expo Parque de los Dinosaurios junto al Parque de las Sonrisas
552256056.author: a TripAdvisor user
552256056.reviewBody: Despu\u00e9s de visitar a los Dinosaurios, los ni\u00f1os se pueden divertirse m\u00e1s en todos los juegos que ah\u00ed se encuentran.

549048749.name: Genial para ni\u00f1os peque\u00f1os
549048749.author: a TripAdvisor user
549048749.reviewBody: Todos los juegos est\u00e1n adaptados para ni\u00f1os de edades menores a 7 a\u00f1os, lo disfrutar\u00e1n mucho. Todo es hecho con material reciclado, excelente su dise\u00f1o.

542456622.name: Divertido
542456622.author: a TripAdvisor user
542456622.reviewBody: Es un parque donde los peques pueden pasar un rato agradable, el lugar esta muy bien cuidado y limpio, los juegos se encuentran en muy buen estado

535220193.name: Los ni\u00f1os se van a divertir!
535220193.author: a TripAdvisor user
535220193.reviewBody: Es entrada  libre (a un lado se encuentra el marque de los dinosaurios), el tema es la ciudad con juegos hechos de madera, para ni\u00f1os no mayores de 1.20 cm y no mayores de 7 a\u00f1os, no hay \u00e1rboles por lo que tienen que usar protector solar, sombrillas y gorras para el sol, hay tienditas de snacks,

508605008.name: Perfecto para dia de campo
508605008.author: a TripAdvisor user
508605008.reviewBody: Es un parque en el cual diafrutar de un bello dia de campo en compa\u00f1ia de la pareja o de la familia, para los peque\u00f1ines la mini ciudad es divertida

499157663.name: Aprende, mientras te diviertes.
499157663.author: a TripAdvisor user
499157663.reviewBody: Un Bellisimo parque con tem\u00e1tica de ciudad para los mas peque\u00f1os... Pueden pasar un d\u00eda de total diversi\u00f3n y seguros en un \u00e1rea dedicada especialmente a ellos

659731569.name: Gran esfuerzo de rescate.
659731569.author: a TripAdvisor user
659731569.reviewBody: Una impresionante obra arquitect\u00f3nica, disfrutaras con t\u00e9tricas o rom\u00e1nticas historias que sucedieron entre sus paredes, a\u00fan falta mucho por hacer, pero el municipio ha logrado un avance significativo en su rescate, rescate que el mismo INAH hace imposible. Seguro disfrutaras recorrer todo el lugar. Durante el festival de la cerveza se realizan catas y maridajes dentro de este recinto a la luz de velas en un ambiente muy singular, pasaras la velada entre romanticismo y miedo.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

657228769.name: En restauraci\u00f3n.
657228769.author: a TripAdvisor user
657228769.reviewBody: Loable el esfuerzo en restaurar este importante convento, que forma parte de la historia de Orizaba, vale la pena visitarlo. Recordar que fue hace algunos a\u00f1os una vecindad de mala muerte.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

648771741.name: Hermoso  y tetrico
648771741.author: a TripAdvisor user
648771741.reviewBody: Es un excelente  lugar para  visitar con gu\u00eda o sin gu\u00eda, pero  si eres como  yo que  te hacen  mal las energ\u00edas .. ni te  metas

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

645443435.name: Una antiguedad de usos multiple con diversas historias que dan miedo.
645443435.author: a TripAdvisor user
645443435.reviewBody: Este ex convento, antigua vecindad, entre otros usos permite el recorrido con gu\u00edas que cuentan historias de terror y por su aspecto f\u00fanebre ese lugar da miedo, entre muertes por accidente y amor\u00edos existen apariciones, tiene amplios jardines y es usado para eventos, se ubica en un lugar que tiene venta de comida, mesas de Pin Pon y es usado para kermeses.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

645010914.name: Laberinto para explorar en familia
645010914.author: a TripAdvisor user
645010914.reviewBody: La construcci\u00f3n es impactante, el hecho de que muestre el paso del tiempo permite liberar la imaginaci\u00f3n a ni\u00f1os, adolescentes y adultos. Muy recomendable!

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

641566325.name: Lo mejor que hay en Orizaba
641566325.author: a TripAdvisor user
641566325.reviewBody: El trabajo de recuperaci\u00f3n que se ha hecho en el ex-convento es impresionante. El edificio es muy bonito y abundante en historia. S\u00faper recomendable hacer el recorrido guiado ya que aprendes de una forma m\u00e1s amena

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

638613515.name: Abbandonato ma interessante
638613515.author: a TripAdvisor user
638613515.reviewBody: E\' stata una bella visita guidata con spiegazione della suddivisione delle varie zone del ex convento . \nAll\'interno si aprono cortili e giardini , a volte pericolanti, ma tutto in sicurezza.\nConsigliata a tutti

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

633494184.name: Muy bonito
633494184.author: a TripAdvisor user
633494184.reviewBody: Es un gran lugar para visitar con la familia, amigos o solo. La restauraci\u00f3n esta quedando genial y la descripci\u00f3n que tiene es muy detallada. Sugiero tomar la visita guiada para disfrutar aun mas el recorrido. El ex convento de San Jose es un lugar muy recomendado para visitar en Orizaba.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

631374103.name: mistico y espectacular
631374103.author: a TripAdvisor user
631374103.reviewBody: es una lugar en donde se puede apreciar con detalle, el tipo de arquitectura estilo colonial con grandes toques de magia y misticismo, sin dejar de percibir ambientes sensaciones misteriosas.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

612335272.name: Mucho por mejorar
612335272.author: a TripAdvisor user
612335272.reviewBody: \u00c9ste lugar siempre fue un misterio mientras yo viv\u00ed en la ciudad, era imposible entrar y se escuchaban muchas historias del mismo. Ahora que ha sido abierto al p\u00fablico esperaba algo un poco diferente. Le falta todav\u00eda mucho mantenimiento y acceso a muchos lugares dentro. Los jardines son grandes y bonitos.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

603204499.name: Vale la pena visitarle...
603204499.author: a TripAdvisor user
603204499.reviewBody: Es un lugar al que no necesitas invertirle mucho tiempo, pero caminar entre sus pasillos y jardines te traslada a una \u00e9poca muy diferente. As\u00ed mismo, el sitio est\u00e1 muy bien se\u00f1alizado y documentado al interior.\nBuen sitio...

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

600921345.name: Muy interesante
600921345.author: a TripAdvisor user
600921345.reviewBody: Es lugar amplio, limpio y el recorrido no es pesado para quienes llevamos ni\u00f1os, el costo es accesible y te dan la opci\u00f3n de hacer el recorrido solo o con gu\u00eda para explicaci\u00f3n mejor de la historia del convento sin embargo en los pasillos hay personal d\u00e1ndote indicaciones y haciendote comentarios a grandes rasgos del mismo. Despert\u00f3 mi curiosidad saber que en un \u00e1rea espec\u00edfica realizaban exorcismos.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

595929691.name: Un hermoso d\u00eda .
595929691.author: a TripAdvisor user
595929691.reviewBody: Es un lugar hermoso,enigm\u00e1tico y cultural felicidades por rescatar tan hermoso  sitio solo le hace falta un poco de personal de vigilancia las personas dejan las colillas de cigarro en donde gustan.\nMil gracias por su trabajo

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

589243840.name: Mistico e impresionante
589243840.author: a TripAdvisor user
589243840.reviewBody: Un ex convento que te da la oportunidad de mesclar lo real con lo fant\u00e1stico al escuchar sus leyendas, por cierto ten cuidado, el ni\u00f1o de la ventana te puede estar viendo

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

573813644.name: Hist\u00f3rico y sumamente t\u00e9trico.
573813644.author: a TripAdvisor user
573813644.reviewBody: Un recorrido sumamente interesante, ya sea con gu\u00eda o libre, cuenta con se\u00f1alamientos, los cuales narran uno que otro acontecimiento. \nEl pasar por sus muros, nos transporta a \u00e9pocas remotas, incluso al conocer un poco de la historia de este lugar, uno puede adentrarse a\u00fan m\u00e1s. \nTiene un toque terror\u00edfico, lo cual lo hace excelente para las personas a las cuales les gustan este tipo de cosas y sobre todo conocer la historia m\u00e1s a fondo de los lugares m\u00e1s importantes de Orizaba.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

569214391.name: Representaci\u00f3n de la ultima cena.
569214391.author: a TripAdvisor user
569214391.reviewBody: Es un gran lugar, en donde se llevo a cabo la representaci\u00f3n de la ultima cena, para los que anden en Orizaba les recomiendo visitarlo los dias 28 y 29 es entrada libre

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

562525514.name: Arrepios
562525514.author: a TripAdvisor user
562525514.reviewBody: \u00c9 pra dar arrepios. Lugar interessante, precisa gostar de hist\u00f3ria e religi\u00e3o para visita-lo, ou n\u00e3o.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

558177928.name: M\u00e1gico, hist\u00f3rico, t\u00e9trico y hermoso!!
558177928.author: a TripAdvisor user
558177928.reviewBody: Tomamos el paseo libre ya que no llegamos en horario de visita guiada, a\u00fan as\u00ed lo disfrutamos much\u00edsimo. Nos comentaron que luego har\u00e1n paseos nocturnos con un toque de miedo y en base a las leyendas del lugar. Lo recomiendo much\u00edsimo!!

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

555204878.name: T\u00e9trico y lindo
555204878.author: a TripAdvisor user
555204878.reviewBody: Pasen a verlo, est\u00e1 t\u00e9trico e interesante, para pasar un rato de risas y adrenalina con la familia en un domingo

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

552253472.name: Ex Convento de San Jos\u00e9 de Gracia
552253472.author: a TripAdvisor user
552253472.reviewBody: A\u00fan en este tiempo cala al pasear por sus pasillos y al leer su historia te deja reflexionado... Es fant\u00e1stico visitarlo, un pasaje m\u00e1s de la historia.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

551050114.name: L\u00fagubre y m\u00e1gico
551050114.author: a TripAdvisor user
551050114.reviewBody: La sensaci\u00f3n desde el momento que llegas a la entrada es extra\u00f1a, a\u00fan cuando seas esc\u00e9ptico, el lugar capta tu atenci\u00f3n de muy distintas formas, ya sea por las leyendas descritas en cada pasillo, su derruida arquitectura, el juego de luces y sombras, la soledad,etc. Una visita que no te puedes perder, que amerita recorrer con mucha calma, y conocer todos los aspectos que le rodean, desde el hist\u00f3rico hasta lo paranormal. Si subes al telef\u00e9rico, te dan un boleto y entras gratis aqu\u00ed, si no, son 30 pesos, no cuentan con paqueter\u00eda, pero puedes dejar tu mochila encargada a la entrada

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

550537720.name: Un excelente lugar para visitar
550537720.author: a TripAdvisor user
550537720.reviewBody: Me gusto que lo hayan remodelado y espero que mantengan el aspecto de ruinas pero deber\u00edan abrir los pisos superiores tienen unos pasillos impresionantes y una pintura de la virgen de guadalupe, basta con que arreglen las escaleras y les pongan un barandal con mas seguridad

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

547426881.name: Lugar M\u00edstico y Lleno de Historia
547426881.author: a TripAdvisor user
547426881.reviewBody: EL lugar esta muy bonito, y se siente una vibra especial, la gente dice que al pasar las almas de los monjes que estuvieron ah\u00ed te pueden llegar a tocar, y como gran parte del recorrido se hace a oscuras, si puede llegar a darte miedo o sentir algo especial, grandes historias nos fueron contadas, algunas tiernas otras medias t\u00e9tricas, pero vale la pena ir a visitarlo y si es cayendo la noche mejor. Es uno de los \u00fanicos lugares en los que nos cobraron la entrada, fueron $50.00 Esta ubicado casi a 200 mtrs. del parque donde abordas el telef\u00e9rico. Lo recomiendo ampliamente.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

542464956.name: Sitio con mucha Historia
542464956.author: a TripAdvisor user
542464956.reviewBody: El lugar en si es imponente, tiene mucha historia y es muy interesante recorrer sus pasillos, se siente un ambiente de misticismo y hasta de terror en algunos pasillos por la oscuridad de los mismos. el acceso es de $30.00\nEl edificio no ha sido restaurado, ni modificado en su mayor\u00eda, solo en algunas partes del techo al parecer les pusieron algunas laminas

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

541028567.name: \u00a1Fascinante!
541028567.author: a TripAdvisor user
541028567.reviewBody: El lugar en si en magico y te transporta a epocas remotas. En nuestro caso, mas aun ya que estuvimos solos y completamente a oscuras toda la visita.... la verdad que fue casi como un tunel del terror y a momentos tuvimos miedo miedo. Estuvo reloco pero bueno. Al dia siguiente queriamos volver para verlo con luz pero ya no lo hicimos; queda pendiente!! \nHay unos paneles explicativos muy buenos la verdad!\nLugar hermoso y se nota su historia.

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

532007942.name: Inperdible
532007942.author: a TripAdvisor user
532007942.reviewBody: Muy padre, para visitar guiado o sin gu\u00eda ya que tiene se\u00f1alizaci\u00f3nes, ampliamente recomendable si viajas a Orizaba

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

520625821.name: Historia de Orizaba
520625821.author: a TripAdvisor user
520625821.reviewBody: Excelente lugar historico de la regi\u00f3n, vale la pena visitarlo y observar como era la vida de las monjas antig\u00fcamente

itemReviewed.name: Ex Convento de San Jose de Gracia

632830989.name: Good Hike
632830989.author: a TripAdvisor user
632830989.reviewBody: It Was The Highlight Of My Trip To Orizaba, And I Was Not Disappointed. The Park Is Not That Big... But Beautifully Kept. Talk To The Locals.... They Can Explain The Steps Better Than I Can... My Personal Experience Was Very Good. I Took The Path To The Right At Bottom Of Stairs Followed It To "Los Sifones" And Was A Very Pleasant Hike... \nHighly Recommended....

380074274.name: 500 Contaminations.
380074274.author: a TripAdvisor user
